title: US revokes visas for six foreigners over comments made about Charlie Kirk’s death
byline: The U.S. State Department said on Tuesday it had revoked the visas of six foreigners over social media comments made about the assassination of conservative activist Charlie Kirk.

title: Heavy rainfall expected in parts of the island
byline: The Meteorology Department states that the Intertropical Convergence Zone (where winds from the Northern Hemisphere and Southern Hemisphere converge) and the atmospheric disturbances in the vicinity of the island are currently influencing the weather over the island.

title: Narcotics haul found floating in southern seas: Over 800kg of drugs including 670kg of ‘Ice’
byline: The exact contents of the 51 packages found floating on seas off the southern coast, which were recovered by the Sri Lanka Navy and brought to the Tangalle fisheries harbour last evening, have been revealed by the navy today.

title: Man dead after earth mound collapses in mine
byline: A man has reportedly died after a mound of earth collapsed in a mine in the Agarathenna area of the Passara Police Division.

title: Attorney Gunaratne Wanninayake files writ petition seeking to prevent arrest
byline: Attorney-at-Law Gunaratne Wanninayake has filed a writ petition with the Court of Appeal through his lawyers seeking an order to prevent his arrest in connection with an alleged incident at the Mount Lavinia Magistrate’s Court premises.

title: Two STF personnel head to Nepal to help bring back ‘Ishara Sewwandi’ and 4 others
byline: Two Special Task Force (STF) personnel have left for Nepal to assist the CID team already there to bring back the five Sri Lankan suspects, including ‘Ishara Sewwandi,’ who is a main suspect in the killing of ‘Ganemulla Sanjeewa’.

title: Grammy-winning neo-soul singer D’Angelo dies at 51
byline: Grammy-winning R&B artist D’Angelo, a pioneer of neo-soul music, died at the age of 51 on Tuesday “after a prolonged and courageous battle with cancer,” his family said in a statement.

title: Bangladesh garment factory fire kills 16, toll may rise
byline: A fire on Tuesday at a garment factory in Bangladesh and an adjacent chemical warehouse killed at least 16 people and injured others, and the death toll could rise, an official said.

title: Ex-Minister Manusha Nanayakkara arrives at Bribery Commission
byline: Former Minister of Labour and Foreign Employment Manusha Nanayakkara has arrived at the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC), to record a statement, a short while ago.

title: ‘Ishara Sewwandi’ to be brought back to Sri Lanka today?
byline: ‘Ishara Sewwandi’, the fugitive female suspect wanted in connection with the murder of underworld figure Sanjeewa Kumara Samararatne alias ‘Ganemulla Sanjeewa,’ who was arrested in Nepal yesterday (14), is scheduled to be brought back to Sri Lanka today (15), according to police sources.

title: PM Harini to undertake official visit to India tomorrow
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya is scheduled to undertake an official visit to India from 16-18 October 2025.

title: Gold prices continue to surge in Sri Lanka
byline: Gold prices in Sri Lanka have increased by over Rs. 5,000 today (15) in comparison to yesterday’s (14) rates.

title: PNB Director transferred; New Director appointed to Police Narcotics Bureau
byline: Senior Superintendent of Police (SSP) Hemal Prashantha, who served as the Director of the Police Narcotics Bureau (PNB), has been transferred to the Police Field Force Headquarters as its Acting Commander.

title: Attorney Gunaratne Wanninayake prepared to appear before court
byline: The legal counsel for Attorney-at-Law Gunaratne Wanninayake has informed the Court of Appeal that his client is prepared to appear before the Mt. Lavinia Magistrate’s Court in connection with the recent incident that occurred at the Mt. Lavinia Magistrate’s court premises.

title: Kopai Police Station temporarily removed following court order
byline: The Kopai Police Station has been temporarily removed from its current location, police sources confirmed.

title: Hamas hands over hostage bodies after Israel threatens aid cut
byline: Hamas handed over more bodies of deceased hostages to Israel on Tuesday (Oct 14), one sign of progress after a number of apparent setbacks in the day since United States President Donald Trump touted his plan to end the Gaza war.

title: PM Harini returns after concluding China visit
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya has returned to Sri Lanka this morning (15) after successfully concluding her visit to China to attend the Global Leaders’ Meeting on Women 2025, undertaken at the invitation of the Government of the People’s Republic of China.

title: Gunaratne Wanninayake appears before Mount Lavinia Magistrate’s Court
byline: Attorney-at-Law Gunaratne Wanninayake has appeared before the Mount Lavinia Magistrate’s Court.

title: Govt. to launch several initiatives to boost tourism ahead of upcoming season
byline: The government has launched several initiatives aimed at improving facilities and services for tourists ahead of the upcoming tourist season.

title: Manusha Nanayakkara arrested by Bribery Commission
byline: Former Minister of Labour and Foreign Employment Manusha Nanayakkara has been arrested by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC), a short while ago.

title: All IMF reviews expected to conclude by mid-2027: CBSL Governor
byline: All reviews under the International Monetary Fund’s (IMF) Extended Fund Facility are expected to be completed by the middle of the year 2027, the Governor of the Central Bank, Dr. Nandalal Weerasinghe stated.

title: Stock of mortar rounds recovered from land in Kilinochchi
byline: The Pallai Police has recovered a stock of 40 mortar shells from a plot of land in the Potthar Kudiyirippu area of Muhamalai, Kilinochchi.

title: Manusha Nanayakkara produced before Colombo Magistrate’s Court
byline: (UPDATED) Former Minister Manusha Nanayakkara, who was arrested earlier today (15) by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC), has been produced before the Colombo Magistrate’s Court, a short while ago.

title: South Korea bars travel to parts of Cambodia amid concerns over scam centres
byline: South Korea on Wednesday (Oct 15) issued travel bans on parts of Cambodia over growing concerns about its citizens being lured to scam centres in the Southeast Asian country.

title: Five arrested over the seizure of over 800kg of narcotics in southern coast
byline: The STF arrested five suspects in connection with 670 kg of ICE, 156 kg of Heroin, and 12 kg of Hashish recovered by the SL Navy while floating off the southern coast.

title: Israel PM Benjamin Netanyahu in court for corruption trial appearance
byline: Israel’s Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu was back in a Tel Aviv court on Wednesday (Oct 15) for the latest hearing in his long-running corruption trial, which opened in May 2020.

title: Govt to introduce four key bills under proposed Labour Law reforms
byline: The government is preparing to introduce four key bills under the proposed labour law reforms, the Minister of Labor and Deputy Minister of Finance and Planning,  Anil Jayantha Fernando has stated.

title: Parliament to debate Personal Data Protection (Amendment) Bill next week
byline: Parliament is scheduled to debate the Personal Data Protection (Amendment) Bill next week.

title: Five arrested over the seizure of 839kg of narcotics in southern coast
byline: A total of five individuals have been apprehended over the seizure of over 830kg of narcotics in Southern seas yesterday (14).

title: Pakistan, Afghanistan agree to temporary, 48-hour ceasefire, Islamabad says
byline: Pakistan and the Afghan Taliban administration have agreed to a temporary ceasefire for 48 hours starting 6:00 p.m. Pakistan local time on Wednesday, Islamabad said, after fresh fighting erupted between the neighbours.

title: ‘Ishara Sewwandi’ brought back to Sri Lanka from Nepal
byline: ‘Ishara Sewwandi’, the fugitive female suspect wanted in connection with the murder of underworld figure Sanjeewa Kumara Samararatne alias ‘Ganemulla Sanjeewa,’ who was arrested in Nepal yesterday (14), has arrived in Sri Lanka.

title: UNP reiterates its call for opposition factions to unite to protect the multi-party system in Sri Lanka
byline: The United National Party says it is of the view that all political parties must be brought together on to one platform to protect the democratic multi-party system in Sri Lanka.

title: OpenAI to allow erotic content on ChatGPT for verified adults
byline: OpenAI announced plans on Tuesday to relax restrictions on its ChatGPT chatbot, including allowing erotic content for verified adult users as part of what the company calls a “treat adult users like adults” principle. MORE>.

title: New Secretaries appointed to two Ministries
byline: W.W.S. Mangala, a Special Grade Officer of the Sri Lanka Planning Service, has been appointed as the new Secretary to the Ministry of Ports and Civil Aviation, the President’s Media Division stated.

title: Attorney Gunaratne Wanninayake granted bail
byline: Attorney-at-Law Gunaratne Wanninayake has been granted bail by the Mount Lavinia Magistrate’s Court.

title: Ex-Minister Manusha Nanayakkara granted bail
byline: Former Minister of Labour and Foreign Employment Manusha Nanayakkara, who was arrested by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC), earlier today has been granted bail, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: Apple rolls out devices with more powerful M5 chip
byline: Apple unveiled a series of product updates on Wednesday, including a refreshed MacBook Pro, an iPad Pro and a second generation of the Vision Pro headset, as it embeds its latest M5 chip across devices aimed at creative professionals.

title: Landslide warnings issued to residents of seven districts
byline: Early landslide warnings have been issued to residents of multiple areas in seven districts owing to incessant rains experienced in parts of the island.

title: Five arrested over the seizure of 839kg of narcotics in southern seas
byline: A total of five individuals have been apprehended over the seizure of over 830kg of narcotics in Southern seas yesterday (14).

title: Sri Lankan passport drops to 98th in global rankings
byline: The Sri Lankan passport has dropped to 98th place in the latest Henley Passport Index 2025 Global Ranking.

title: Showers to increase in the next few days
byline: Showery weather conditions over the island are expected to enhance in the next few days due to the influence of the Intertropical Convergence Zone and the atmospheric disturbances in the vicinity of the island, the Department of Meteorology said.

title: IMF chief says lack of retaliation against Trump tariffs aiding global growth
byline: Decisions by most countries to not retaliate against US President Donald Trump’s tariffs are among the top factors bolstering the global economy’s resilience, IMF Managing Director Kristalina Georgieva said on Tuesday.

title: Pakistan, Afghanistan agree to 48-hour ceasefire, Islamabad says
byline: Pakistan and the Afghan Taliban administration have agreed to a temporary ceasefire for 48 hours starting 6:00 p.m. Pakistan local time on Wednesday, Islamabad said, after fresh fighting erupted between the neighbours.
